title: [StatusChatInput] Left/Right keys wrongfully inserts or deletes mention

body:
# Bug Report

## Description

Trying to edit and navigate a text containing mention can trigger an unexpected mention or altering the mention.
<!-- Provide a short description describing the problem you are experiencing. -->

## Case 1
### Steps to reproduce

1. Open a new chat with contact JohnDoe
2. Type `Hello @JohnDoe!`
3. Mention is inserted and the text looks like this `Hello @JohnDoe !`
4. Hit backspace twice to delete ` !`
5. Mentions suggestions is opened
6. Hit Left key
<!-- example: step 1. do X step 2. do Y etc.. -->

#### Expected behavior
Cursor moves before the mention
#### Actual behavior
A new mention is inserted to the right
### Additional Information

## Case 2
### Steps to reproduce

1. Open a new chat with contact `JohnDoe1` and `JohnDoe2`
2. Type `Hello @JohnDoe1@JohnDoe2!`
3. Mention is inserted and the text looks like this `Hello @JohnDoe1 @JohnDoe2 !`
4. Delete the space between mentions
5. Mentions suggestions is opened
6. Hit Right key
<!-- example: step 1. do X step 2. do Y etc.. -->

#### Expected behavior
Cursor moves after the second mention
#### Actual behavior
The mention to the right is deleted
### Additional Information

## The qml test needs to be updated as well (StatusChatInputMentions::test_mention_cannot_be_invalidated). See #12393
